intro: Chamaeraphis aspera, commonly known as the rough glassworts, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, salt-tolerant stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in brackish or saline environments, such as tidal flats and marshes. Its small, green flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it often forms dense mats on the ground. Chamaeraphis aspera is adapted to withstand harsh coastal conditions, making it an important component of coastal ecosystems.
